abstract.text: Generates a signature that you can use to authenticate the local player on your own server.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A block that GameKit calls when the request completes.
The block receives the following parameters:
The URL for the public encryption key.
publicKeyURL
The verification signature data that GameKit generates.
signature
A random
that GameKit uses to compute the hash and randomize it.
salt
The signature’s creation date and time.
timestamp
If an error occurs, this parameter holds an error object that explains the error. Otherwise, the value of this parameter is
error
To generate a signature for your authentication server, you perform steps in the game and pass data to the server, which completes the process.
In your game, follow these steps:
Call the
method.
Send the completion handler
, and
parameters to your authentication server.
Share the
and the bundle ID (see
) with the server. For Apple Arcade games, share the
instead of the
On the server, perform these steps:
To mitigate replay attacks, make sure the
parameter is recent, and to avoid high network overhead, respect the cache expiration headers.
Download the public key using the
parameter.
Verify with the appropriate signing authority that Apple signed the public key.
Concatenate the following information into a data buffer in this order: the
(or
for Apple Arcade) property in UTF-8 format, the bundle ID in UTF-8 format, the
parameter in big-endian UInt64 format, and the
parameter.
Use the public key to verify the signature of the concatenated data buffer using the
algorithm.
If the generated and retrieved signatures match, GameKit authenticates the local player.
Trust only the fields in the signed payload. Consider other data, such as nicknames, as player-provided information.

abstract.text: A unique identifier for a bundle.
A notification that posts after GameKit authenticates the local player.
Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
The local player who signs in to Game Center on the device running the game.
A handler that GameKit calls while authenticating the local player.
Generates a signature that you can use to authenticate the local player on your own server.
A Boolean value that indicates whether a local player has signed in to Game Center.
A unique identifier for a player of the game.
A unique identifier for a player of all the games that you distribute using your developer account.
A notification that posts after GameKit authenticates the local player.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
